intro: Koompassia excelsa, commonly known as the African mahogany, is a towering tropical tree native to Central and West Africa. It is characterized by its straight, durable timber and can grow up to 50 meters in height. The tree has a dense canopy with elongated, dark green leaves that are alternate and compound. Its flowers are small and yellowish, and it produces woody pods containing flat, winged seeds. Due to its valuable wood, it is often harvested for commercial use, leading to conservation concerns.
